snippet: The Paris area reeled Friday night from a shooting rampage, explosions and mass hostage-taking that President François Hollande called an unprecedented terrorist attack on France.
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande announces sharply increased border controls and heightens police powers after series of terrorist attacks in Paris leave more than 100 people dead; United States and Germany are among first to offer assistance.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Aurelien Breeden, Liz Alderman, Marlise Simons, Nicola Clark and Mary Ann Giordano from Paris; Melissa Eddy from Berlin; Sewell Chan from London; and Gardiner Harris, Eric Schmitt Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Paris area reeled Friday night from a shooting rampage, explosions and mass hostage-taking that President François Hollande called an unprecedented terrorist attack on France.

headline.sub: Shootings and Blasts, Apparently in Sync
headline.main: Paris Attacks Kill More Than 100, Police Say; Border Controls Tightened
headline.print_headline: Series of Shootings and Blasts, Apparently Coordinated
